Authors:
Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Hong-Bo Jiang, Er-Fu Yang, Saowaluck
Tibpromma, Jayarama D. Bhat, Samantha C. Karunarathna, Dong-Qin Dai,
Jian-Chu Xu, ITTHAYAKORN PROMPUTTHA
Title:
Taxonomic reappraisal of Periconia (Periconiaceae,
Massarineae, Pleosporales)
Keywords:
Bambusistroma; Dothideomycetes; hyphomycetes; Noosia; the
Greater Mekong Subregion
Abstract:
Abstract: An ongoing research survey of microfungi in
Yunnan, China, saprobic hyphomycetes were collected from various host
substrates and were identified as Periconia species based on
morphological characteristics. We thus, obtained DNA sequence data of
these Periconia species from pure cultures and investigated their
phylogenetic affinities. Phylogenetic analyses of a combined LSU, ITS,
SSU and tef1-α sequence dataset demonstrated that five isolates of
Periconia species formed well-resolved subclades within Periconiaceae.
Thus, three new Periconia species are introduced viz. P. artemisiae, P.
chimonanthi and P. thysanolaenae and new host and geographical records
of the other two known species, P. byssoides and P. pseudobyssoides are
also reported from dead branches of Prunus armeniaca and Scrophularia
ningpoensis Hemsl., respectively. Periconia celtidis formed a
monophyletic clade with P. byssoides in present phylogenetic analyses
and the results of the pairwise homoplasy index (PHI) test indicated
significant recombination between P. byssoides and P. celtidis.
Therefore, P. celtidis is synonymized under P. byssoides. In addition,
we re-illustrated and studied the type specimen of the sexual genus
Bambusistroma. The type species of Bambusistroma, B. didymosporum has
similar morphology with the sexual morph of Periconia homothallica and
P. pseudodigitata. We, therefore, synonymized Bambusistroma under
Periconia based on morphological and phylogenetic evidence. Furthermore,
our new isolates sporulated the brown conidial hyphomycetes on media
agar typical of the genus Noosia. Based on morphological comparison with
Periconia in vitro and phylogenetic status of Noosia, we also treat
Noosia as a synonym of Periconia. Detailed descriptions, illustrations,
and the updated phylogenetic tree of Periconiaceae through maximum
likelihood and Bayesian inference analyses are provided. Generic
circumscription of Periconia is emended.
